text: Muhammad ibn Sa'id ibn al-Sarh al-Kinani (), alternatively given as Sa'id ibn Sarh, was a ninth century governor of the Yemen for the Abbasid Caliphate. A member of the ahl Filastin ("people of Palestine"), Ibn al-Sarh was appointed to the Yemen during the caliphate of al-Amin (r. 809–813). Although little is known of his administration, by the time he left office he had accumulated a large amount of wealth, which he took with him when he departed from the province during the Fourth Fitna. He then returned to Palestine,; ; . skips over his governorship. and is subsequently mentioned as seizing control of al- Ramlah during the chaos of the Fitna.; ; . == Notes == == References == * * * * * * * Category:Abbasid governors of Yemen Category:9th-century people of the Abbasid Caliphate Category:9th-century Arabs
title: Muhammad ibn Sa'id al-Kinani
